display_name: child's physician has identified a change in signs or symptoms that warrants alternative treatment for osa (initiation of cpap for example)
child has developed new academic or behavioral problems resulting in a recommendation for grade retention
child has begun counseling or placement on medications for behavior or emotional problems
recurrent bacterial tonsillitis (3 or more episodes of streptococcal culture positive infection occuring over a 3 month period)
new clinical diagnosis of cor pulmonale
development of failure to thrive defined by weight loss during the course of follow-up
new onset stage 2 hypertension, which is not better explained by another medical condition
new onset hypersomnolence defined as reports of falling asleep on average > 3 times per week, which is not better explained by other factors unrelated to osa
parent / caregiver decision to have adenotonsillectomy surgery (wwsc group)
parent / caregiver decision to not have adentonsillectomy surgery (eat group)
other medical or neuropsycholigical necessitated reason, specify
